---
title: "QTM 151 - Introduction to Statistical Computing II"
---

## Course Overview

Welcome to [QTM 151](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer)! This course introduces students to data analysis and statistical computing using Python and SQL. Please have a look at [the course syllabus](https://danilofreire.github.io/qtm151-summer/syllabus.html) and the [lecture schedule](https://danilofreire.github.io/qtm151-summer/lectures.html) for more information. A brief overview of the course content is provided below.

## Contact Information

- **Name**: Danilo Freire
- **Contact**: <danilo.freire@emory.edu>
- **Office Hours**: By appointment at your convenience, please email me to schedule a meeting

## Repository Structure

While this website provides an overview of the course materials, the primary source of content is the course's GitHub repository at <https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer>. The repository is organised as follows:

- [`assignments/`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/assignments): Contains all course assignments
- [`lectures/`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/lectures): Includes lecture materials and code
- [`tutorials/`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/tutorials): Step-by-step guides for the tools used in the course
- [`syllabus.pdf`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/blob/main/syllabus.pdf): Course syllabus in PDF format

Please also refer to the Discussion tab on the repository for any questions or comments: <https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/discussions>. 

**Note**: The links will take you to the respective folders or files in the repository, not on this website. You can find links for the rendered content in the navigation bar above.

## Course Content

### Lectures

We will meet every weekday from May 13th to May 30th, 2025 from 11:30 AM to 12:50 PM. Our meetings will be online via Zoom. The link is <https://emory.zoom.us/j/1234567890> (please check the course website for the correct link).  Please check the [course schedule](https://danilofreire.github.io/qtm151-summer/lectures/lectures.html) for the full list of topics and dates. Lecture materials are available in the [lectures folder](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/lectures) in the repository.

Each folder contains an HTML presentation or a Jupyter notebook (`.ipynb`) with code examples and explanations, along with any additional resources or datasets used in the lecture.

### Assignments and Quizzes

Throughout the course, students will complete various assignments and quizzes to reinforce their learning. The assignments will be posted in the [`assignments/`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/assignments) folder as the course progresses. The quizzes will be available as separate GitHub repositories. We will also announce these in class and on Canvas. Please refer to the syllabus or the lecture schedule for due dates and
submission guidelines.

### Tutorials

The [`tutorials/`](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/tutorials) tab contains step-by-step guides for various tools and techniques used in the course. Please have a look at
these resources to help you get started. 

PDF versions of the tutorials are also [available in the repository](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/tutorials).

## Course Requirements

- Prerequisites: None, only willingness to learn and explore new tools!
- Software: [Anaconda distribution of Python 3.x](https://www.anaconda.com/), [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/), [SQLite](https://www.sqlite.org/), and [GitHub Desktop](https://github.com/apps/desktop) 
- Please also create an educational account on [GitHub](https://education.github.com/)

## Grading

- Assignments: 50%
- Class Quizzes: 50%

## Course Policies and Expectations

For detailed information on course policies, grading criteria, attendance requirements, and academic integrity guidelines, please refer to the [syllabus](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/blob/main/syllabus.pdf) in the repository or [on the course website](https://danilofreire.github.io/qtm151-summer/syllabus.html).

## Getting Help

If you encounter any issues with the course materials or have questions about the content, please:

1. Check the [course syllabus](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/blob/main/syllabus.pdf) for relevant information
2. Review the [lecture materials](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/tree/main/lectures) and

   course website
3. Consult with your classmates or post in the [course discussion forum](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/discussions)
4. Attend office hours or schedule an appointment with the instructor

## Contributing to the Repository

While this repository is primarily maintained by the course instructor, everyone is welcome to contribute. Please feel free to suggest improvements or report issues by [opening a GitHub issue](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/issues), [submitting a pull request](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/pulls), [creating a discussion post](https://github.com/danilofreire/qtm151-summer/discussions), or [contacting the instructor directly](mailto:danilo.freire@emory.edu).
